intro: Cerastium beeringianum, commonly known as the Beering's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, hairy leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky and gravelly soils, often found in tundra and mountainous environments. Cerastium beeringianum is adapted to cold climates and is an important component of the Arctic flora.
